<DESCRIPTION>EX-10.8: EMPLOYMENT AGREEMENT WIT KEVIN THORNTON
<TEXT>
<HTML>
<HEAD>
<TITLE>EX-10.8</TITLE>
</HEAD>
<BODY bgcolor="#FFFFFF">
<!-- PAGEBREAK -->
<DIV style="font-family: 'Times New Roman',Times,serif">


<DIV align="right" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 12pt"><B>Exhibit&nbsp;10.8</B>
</DIV>


<DIV align="center" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 18pt"><IMG src="y74507y7450703.gif" alt="(COREL LOGO)"></div>
<DIV align="center" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 12pt"><B>PERSONAL AND CONFIDENTIAL</B>
</DIV>


<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">August&nbsp;8, 2007

</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">Kevin Thornton<BR>
802 Regal Court<BR>
Highland Village, Texas 75077

</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">Dear Kevin,
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">We are delighted to present to you this offer of employment with Corel Inc. as our Senior Vice
President, Sales and Marketing, Americas.
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">The details of your employment are:
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt"><B>1.&nbsp;Title</B>: <B>Senior Vice President, Sales and Marketing, Americas</B>, reporting to the Chief Operating
Officer.
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt"><B>2.&nbsp;Place of Work</B>: Your primary place of employment will be remote in Dallas, TX, however, you
will be required to travel frequently to Ottawa, Canada as well other domestic and international
locations as required to meet the business needs.
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt"><B>3.&nbsp;Term: </B>Subject to Section&nbsp;7 below, you will be employed for an indefinite period commencing
<B>September&nbsp;1, 2007.</B>
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt"><B>4.&nbsp;Compensation:</B>
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">A base salary equivalent to <B>US $264,000 </B>per annum, (subject to tax and other withholdings) subject
to annual review and adjustment by the Board. You would also be eligible to participate in our
Annual Incentive Plan (AIP)&nbsp;for executives and your target incentive under this program will be <B>US
$176,000 </B>(subject to tax and other withholdings). The targets would be set annually by the Board
in consultation with you.
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">For fiscal year 2007, your AIP will be paid out at the 100% Payout level prorated for the period
you are employed during fiscal year 2007. For fiscal year 2008, your AIP will be paid out at 100%
Payout level for the Q1 (first quarter) period.
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">In addition, Corel will provide to you a one-time hiring bonus in the amount of <B>$35,000 US</B>
(subject to tax and other withholdings) to be paid out upon submission of documentation referencing
the bonus plan structure of your previous employer. This amount will be payable on the first pay
date following September&nbsp;28, 2007. Should you voluntarily leave your employment with Corel within
the first six (6)&nbsp;months of commencing employment, monies paid to you shall become refundable to
Corel. This refund obligation will reduce on a straight line basis over the six (6)&nbsp;month period.
</DIV>

<P align="center" style="font-size: 10pt"><!-- Folio -->&nbsp;<!-- /Folio -->
</DIV>

<!-- PAGEBREAK -->
<P><HR noshade><P>
<H5 align="left" style="page-break-before:always">&nbsp;</H5><P>

<DIV style="font-family: 'Times New Roman',Times,serif">

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt"><B>5.&nbsp;Stock Options</B>
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">At the next Board of Directors meeting, following your date of hire, your recommended stock option
grant of <B>40,000 </B>options will be presented for approval. These options would vest according to the
terms of the plan which provides vesting of 10,000 of these options on the first anniversary
following the date of grant and thereafter, 2500 options shall vest at the end of each quarter
until all said options are fully vested. These options are governed by the Corel Corporation
Equity Incentive Plan (&#147;the Plan&#148;), as it may be amended from time to time.
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">In addition to your new hire grant, we wish to confirm that, as an executive at Corel, you will be
<B>eligible </B>to participate in our annual key performer grant program. Grants under this program are
discretionary and determined annually and presented to the Board of Directors for approval. A
prescribed date for this grant has not been set, however our intent is to have these grants
approved and distributed to employees before the end of April each year. Nothing in this agreement
or otherwise shall constitute any agreement that you will in fact receive a key performer grant.
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt"><B>6.&nbsp;Group Benefits, 401k and Vacation Plan</B>
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">As a regular full-time employee, you shall be eligible to participate in our group benefits plans,
401k, and vacation plan, effective from your date of hire, in accordance with the established
practices and policies of Corel and our benefit carriers.
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">You will be provided with a summary of our current US group benefits and 401k including pricing.
It is important that you understand the details provided to ensure you have adequate coverage.
Please feel free to contact your local Human Resources Advisor if you have any concerns about
coverage for pre-existing conditions.
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">Your vacation entitlement will start at <B>twenty (20)&nbsp;days per calendar year</B>, pro-rated from date of
hire.
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt"><B>7.&nbsp;At Will Employment</B>
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">Employment with Corel will be in an at-will capacity, meaning that either you or Corel would be
able to end your employment at any time for any reason or no reason with or without advance notice.
Neither this Agreement nor any other oral statements, policies or procedures constitute an express
or implied contract of employment or an agreement of any specific duration or otherwise limit
Corel&#146;s right to terminate your employment and this agreement without notice or, except as
expressly set out in this section, without payment, compensation, benefit or other consideration.
Your at-will status will not be altered except in writing and signed by Corel&#146;s Vice President,
Human Resources.
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">In the event your employment is terminated by Corel without Cause, provided that you execute
a Full and Final Release in a form to be provided by Corel, you will receive:
</DIV>


<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt; margin-left: 2%">(a)&nbsp;a payment equivalent to six (6)&nbsp;months of Base Pay plus six (6)&nbsp;months AIP calculated
as if the AIP was earned at the 100% payout level, prorated for said six (6)&nbsp;month period;
and
</DIV>


<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt; margin-left: 2%">(b)&nbsp;family COBRA coverage for medical and dental for a period of twelve (12)&nbsp;months. If,
prior to completion of the twelve (12)&nbsp;month period following the termination you commence a
position with another employer, or become self-employed, then the COBRA coverage will end.
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">For the purposes of the foregoing &#147;Cause&#148; means:
</DIV>

<P align="center" style="font-size: 10pt"><!-- Folio -->&nbsp;<!-- /Folio -->
</DIV>

<!-- PAGEBREAK -->
<P><HR noshade><P>
<H5 align="left" style="page-break-before:always">&nbsp;</H5><P>

<DIV style="font-family: 'Times New Roman',Times,serif">

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt">
<TABLE width="100%" border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="font-size: 10pt">

<TR valign="top" style="font-size: 10pt; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    <TD width="2%" style="background: transparent">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD width="3%" nowrap align="left">(i)</TD>
    <TD width="1%">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD>theft, fraud, dishonesty or willful misconduct by you in connection with your
duties or involving the property, business or affairs of the company;</TD>
</TR>

<TR>
    <TD style="font-size: 6pt">&nbsp;</TD>
</TR><TR valign="top" style="font-size: 10pt; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    <TD width="2%" style="background: transparent">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD width="3%" nowrap align="left">(ii)</TD>
    <TD width="1%">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD>any breach of the Corel Code of Business Conduct and Ethics;</TD>
</TR>

<TR>
    <TD style="font-size: 6pt">&nbsp;</TD>
</TR><TR valign="top" style="font-size: 10pt; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    <TD width="2%" style="background: transparent">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD width="3%" nowrap align="left">(iii)</TD>
    <TD width="1%">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD>any material breach of any other Corel policy or procedure;</TD>
</TR>

<TR>
    <TD style="font-size: 6pt">&nbsp;</TD>
</TR><TR valign="top" style="font-size: 10pt; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    <TD width="2%" style="background: transparent">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD width="3%" nowrap align="left">(iv)</TD>
    <TD width="1%">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD>a breach by you, in any material respect, of this employment agreement;</TD>
</TR>

<TR>
    <TD style="font-size: 6pt">&nbsp;</TD>
</TR><TR valign="top" style="font-size: 10pt; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    <TD width="2%" style="background: transparent">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD width="3%" nowrap align="left">(v)</TD>
    <TD width="1%">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD>any restriction on your ability to travel freely and without difficulty to
and between the USA, Canada, Taiwan and Japan; or</TD>
</TR>

<TR>
    <TD style="font-size: 6pt">&nbsp;</TD>
</TR><TR valign="top" style="font-size: 10pt; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    <TD width="2%" style="background: transparent">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD width="3%" nowrap align="left">(vi)</TD>
    <TD width="1%">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD>any conduct that would be determined by the courts of Texas to constitute
misconduct<B>.</B></TD>
</TR>

</TABLE>
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt"><B>8.&nbsp;Confidentiality Obligations and IP Assignment</B>:
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">You agree to preserve the confidentiality of Corel information and to assign any industrial and
intellectual property rights you may have or acquire to Corel in accordance with the provisions of
Schedule&nbsp;A attached hereto.
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt"><B>9.&nbsp;Non-Solicitation Obligations:</B>
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">You agree that, during the period of employment with Corel, and in the event of the termination of
your employment for any reason whatsoever within one (1)&nbsp;year of the date of such termination, you
will not indirectly or directly, by any means in any capacity, approach, solicit, or contact in the
course of being engaged in a business competitive with Corel or attempt to direct away from Corel:
</DIV>


<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt; margin-left: 2%">(i)&nbsp;any client or potential client of Corel with whom you had dealings during the term of
your employment with Corel;
</DIV>


<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt; margin-left: 2%">(ii)
any client or potential client made known to you by Corel during the term of your
employment, </div>
<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">or in any manner assist any person in any of the foregoing activities.
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">You agree that during the period of your employment by Corel, and in the event of the termination
of your employment for any reason whatsoever within one (1)&nbsp;year of the date of such termination,
you will not, directly or indirectly, attempt or agree to train, recruit or solicit any person
employed by Corel to provide services to yourself or any person who engages in a business similar
to the business of Corel or in any manner assist any person in any of the foregoing activities.
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt"><B>10.&nbsp;Non-Competition</B>
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">You agree that during the period of your employment, and in the event of the termination of your
employment for any reason whatsoever within one (1)&nbsp;year of the date of such termination, you will
not, directly or indirectly, whether as principal, agent, distributor, representative, consultant,
employee, director, officer, manager, trustee, owner, partner, stockholder, limited partner, joint
venturer, independent contractor, other investor or in any other capacity invest in, undertake,
carry on, be engaged in, be concerned with, have a financial interest in, advise, lend money to,
guarantee the debts or obligations of or permit your name or any part thereof to be used or
employed by or associated with any person or entity engaged in, concerned with or interested in,
directly or indirectly, an undertaking or business anywhere in the world which is engaged in a
business in competition with Corel, other than (1)&nbsp;an investment of not more than five percent (5%)
of the stock, equity or other ownership interests of any person or entity whose applicable
securities are publicly traded; and/or (2)&nbsp;as an employee, where the employer and any affiliate of
the employer carries on
</DIV>

<P align="center" style="font-size: 10pt"><!-- Folio -->&nbsp;<!-- /Folio -->
</DIV>

<!-- PAGEBREAK -->
<P><HR noshade><P>
<H5 align="left" style="page-break-before:always">&nbsp;</H5><P>

<DIV style="font-family: 'Times New Roman',Times,serif">



<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">an undertaking or business (and you are not directly and/or actively involved in that undertaking
or business) in competition with Corel and that undertaking or business amounts to less than 5% of
the annual net revenue of the employer and any affiliate, on a consolidated basis.
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt"><B>11.&nbsp;Employer Policies and Regulations: </B>You agree to abide by Corel&#146;s policies and regulations, as
established from time to time including the Network Use and Security Policy which is attached
hereto as Schedule&nbsp;B.
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt"><B>12.&nbsp;Applicable Law: </B>This agreement and the rights and obligations of the parties hereunder shall
be construed and governed in accordance with the laws of the <B>State of Texas</B>.
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt"><B>13.&nbsp;Entire Agreement: </B>This agreement contains the entire understanding and agreement between the
parties hereto with respect to your employment and any and all previous agreements and
representations, written or oral, express or implied, between the parties hereto or on their
behalf, are hereby void. No amendment or variation of any of the provisions of this agreement
shall be valid unless made in writing and signed by each of the parties hereto.
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt"><B>14.&nbsp;Severability: </B>In the event that any provision herein or part thereof shall be deemed
void, invalid, illegal or unenforceable by a court or other lawful authority of competent
jurisdiction, this agreement shall continue in force with respect to the enforceable provisions and
all rights accrued under the enforceable provisions shall survive any such declaration, and any
non-enforceable provision shall, to the extent permitted by law, be replaced by a provision which,
being valid, comes closest to the intention underlying the invalid, illegal or unenforceable
provision.
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt"><B>15.&nbsp;Corel Affiliates</B>
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">For the purposes of sections 8, 9, 10, and 11 herein the term &#147;Corel&#148; shall include any other
company which is an affiliate of Corel, including, without limitation, Corel Corporation.
</DIV>

<DIV align="center" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 18pt">*&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;*&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;*
</DIV>


<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">It is important to us that you fully understand all of the details of your employment, including
the benefits, any benefit limitations, and services that are available to you. All the attached
documents need to be completed and processed prior to your start date and as a condition of your
employment. Please note that this offer is also contingent upon Corel&#146;s receipt of a clean report
from our third party verification agency. To indicate your acceptance of this offer, please
initial each page and sign below; then return the originals by mail to Corel Corporation, 1600
Carling Avenue, Ottawa, Ontario, K1Z 8R7 to Tracey Clements, HR Advisor in Human Resources and fax
a copy to (613)&nbsp;761-1146. If you have any questions, please feel free to contact Tracey directly
at 613-728-0826 x1738.
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">Kevin, we are convinced that your skills and experience are a terrific match for this position and
that your contribution and commitment with Corel will be rewarding. I look forward to working with
you.
</DIV>

<P align="center" style="font-size: 10pt"><!-- Folio -->&nbsp;<!-- /Folio -->
</DIV>

<!-- PAGEBREAK -->
<P><HR noshade><P>
<H5 align="left" style="page-break-before:always">&nbsp;</H5><P>

<DIV style="font-family: 'Times New Roman',Times,serif">

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 12pt">Best Regards,
</DIV>


<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">/s/ DAVID DOBSON

</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">David Dobson<BR>
CEO

</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">I, <B>Kevin Thornton, </B>acknowledge that I am aware of my right to obtain independent legal advice
before signing this agreement (including Schedule&nbsp;B) and have either received such advice or chosen
not to seek such advice. I acknowledge and agree that I have read and fully understand this
agreement and agree that all such terms are reasonable and that the I sign this agreement freely,
voluntarily and without duress.
</DIV>

<DIV align="center" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 18pt"><U>Schedule&nbsp;A</U>
</DIV>


<DIV align="Center" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt"><B>CONFIDENTIAL INFORMATION</B>

</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;1.&nbsp;You acknowledge that you may, in your capacity as an employee of Corel, from time to time
receive Confidential Information of Corel which Corel wishes and is entitled to protect. You
understand that &#147;Confidential Information&#148; includes, but is not limited to, any part of the
computer systems, software source code, system logic, systems, marketing plans, patents, trade
secrets, know-how, technical expertise, financial information, product information, customer
information, your remuneration package and other information relating to the business of Corel,
whether verbal or written, regardless of the form or medium, with respect to the business of Corel,
as well as all proprietary and other information of a confidential nature which is provided to
Corel by third parties.
</DIV>

<P align="center" style="font-size: 10pt"><!-- Folio -->&nbsp;<!-- /Folio -->
</DIV>

<!-- PAGEBREAK -->
<P><HR noshade><P>
<H5 align="left" style="page-break-before:always">&nbsp;</H5><P>

<DIV style="font-family: 'Times New Roman',Times,serif">

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">2.&nbsp;You agree that you will hold the Confidential Information in trust and confidence for Corel, and
that you will not disclose the Confidential Information to any person or entity without the prior
written approval of Corel or use the Confidential Information for any purpose other than the
specific purposes required by your duties with Corel.
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">3.&nbsp;You agree that you will not copy the Confidential Information without Corel&#146;s written permission
or as required by your duties with Corel. You agree that you will not remove any Confidential
Information from Corel&#146;s premises without the express permission of Corel. If Corel requests, you
will immediately return all Confidential Information in your possession or control to Corel.
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">4.&nbsp;You agree that you will advise Corel promptly of any information known to you prior to your
employment with Corel which could be included as Confidential Information but which you consider to
be excluded from the provisions of this agreement.
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">5.&nbsp;You acknowledge that the disclosure or use of Confidential Information by you contrary to
the terms of this agreement will cause Corel irreparable harm, for which damages may not be
adequate compensation and acknowledge that Corel may apply for equitable relief, including an
injunction, in order to stop any breach or threatened breach by you of this agreement. You are
required to notify Corel immediately of any breach of your obligations under this agreement which
comes to your attention.
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">6.&nbsp;The obligations of confidentiality hereunder shall not apply to any information that
(a)&nbsp;is or becomes information in the public domain without any act or omission by you, (b)&nbsp;was in
your possession free of any obligation of confidentiality before being disclosed to you by Corel,
or <FONT style="font-family: WP TypographicSymbols">&#056;</FONT> was disclosed to you by a third party without breach by such third party of any
obligation to keep such information confidential. You agree to disclose any information which you
believe is qualified by this paragraph before acting upon it.
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">7.&nbsp;You understand and acknowledge that the obligations of confidentiality and non-disclosure
contained in this agreement shall continue in full force and effect notwithstanding the termination
of your employment with Corel and that you must continue to observe these obligations when seeking
new employment.
</DIV>

<DIV align="center" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 18pt"><B>INDUSTRIAL AND INTELLECTUAL PROPERTY</B>
</DIV>


<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">8.&nbsp;You acknowledge that all improvements, inventions, know-how and discoveries, technology,
patents, copyrightable materials, computer programs, designs, documentation, processes, techniques
or procedures in any way related to Corel&#146;s business which are developed, invented, or written by
you alone or together with others, including all derivative works, during the course of your
employment with Corel, or at any time using Confidential Information (&#147;Developments&#148;) are the
exclusive property of Corel.
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">9.&nbsp;You agree that you will fully disclose all Developments to Corel and you hereby waive all your
moral rights in all Developments as of the moment they are created and transfer all your interest
in all Developments, including all derivative works, exclusively to Corel on a world-wide,
royalty-free basis as of the moment they are created and, as required by Corel, will protect
Corel&#146;s interest in such Developments. You agree to execute any documents which Corel feels are
necessary, at Corel&#146;s expense, to enable Corel to apply for or enforce its patent, copyright,
industrial design, trademark right, or any other industrial or intellectual property rights in the
Developments.
</DIV>

<P align="center" style="font-size: 10pt"><!-- Folio -->&nbsp;<!-- /Folio -->
</DIV>

<!-- PAGEBREAK -->
<P><HR noshade><P>
<H5 align="left" style="page-break-before:always">&nbsp;</H5><P>

<DIV style="font-family: 'Times New Roman',Times,serif">

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">10.&nbsp;You acknowledge that you are not a party to any prior agreements which have created, or which
could create in any third party rights which are or could become inconsistent with your obligations
herein, and you agree that you will fully disclose to Corel at your earliest opportunity any such
prior agreements as well as any claims made or notices provided by a third party which allege any
such agreement or interest.
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">11.&nbsp;You acknowledge that, from time to time, Corel uses the image, likeness, voice or other
representation of its employees in connection with the production of corporate reports, advertising
and promotional materials, and training videos. You hereby agree that if, during the course of
your employment, you participate in such productions, Corel may use your image, likeness, voice or
other representation in perpetuity, in all media and in all territories for the purposes described
above without further compensation to you.
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">12.&nbsp;You are required to devote your whole working time and attention to your
employment. You will not, during the term of your employment, perform work or services for any
competitor of Corel. As well, you will not, during your employment with Corel, compete directly or
indirectly with Corel.
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">13.&nbsp;You understand that a failure by Corel to enforce any particular provision of this
agreement is not to be considered a waiver of any of its rights and will not release you of any
responsibility for performance under this agreement.
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">14. The various sections of this agreement are independent and the invalidity of any one
particular clause will not affect the enforce ability of the other provisions of this agreement.
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">I have read, I understand, and I hereby agree to comply with the above terms and conditions of
employment with Corel Inc.
</DIV>
<DIV align="center">
<TABLE style="font-size: 10pt" cellspacing="0" border="0" cellpadding="0" width="100%">

</DIV>



<P align="center" style="font-size: 10pt"><!-- Folio -->&nbsp;<!-- /Folio -->
</DIV>

<!-- PAGEBREAK -->
<P><HR noshade><P>
<H5 align="left" style="page-break-before:always">&nbsp;</H5><P>

<DIV style="font-family: 'Times New Roman',Times,serif">




<DIV align="center" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 18pt">Schedule&nbsp;B
</DIV>


<DIV align="Center" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt"><B>NETWORK USE &#038; SECURITY</B>

</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;The purpose of this policy is to establish guidelines for the proper use of computer network
resources by employees and to increase the overall security of our computer network, including the
Internet and all software, hardware, related equipment and/or services (the &#147;Network&#148;). Improper
use of the Network by you can expose yourself and Corel to potential civil and criminal penalties,
litigation, embarrassment and adverse publicity. Further, the use of unauthorized software on the
Network can compromise Network performance or unduly complicate the work of Corel&#146;s MIS department.
Accordingly, it is important that all employees be familiar with and abide by the terms of this
policy.
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;By using the Network, you acknowledge and agree that:
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;The Network is owned by Corel Inc, its parent, subsidiaries and/or affiliates (&#147;Corel&#148;). It
is to be used:
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt">
<TABLE width="100%" border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="font-size: 10pt">

<TR valign="top" style="font-size: 10pt; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    <TD width="2%" style="background: transparent">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD width="3%" nowrap align="left">$&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD width="1%">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD> only by you; and,</TD>
</TR>

<TR>
    <TD style="font-size: 6pt">&nbsp;</TD>
</TR><TR valign="top" style="font-size: 10pt; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    <TD width="2%" style="background: transparent">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD width="3%" nowrap align="left">$&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD width="1%">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD>primarily for authorized business purposes that are directly related to your work
for Corel.</TD>
</TR>

</TABLE>
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">You may make personal use of the Internet, provided that such personal use does not interfere with
your ability to perform your job and does not otherwise offend this policy; however you should have
no expectation as to privacy with respect to any use of the Internet or the Network.
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">Corel has the right and ability to monitor any and all aspects of your use of the Network,
including, but not limited to, monitoring sites that you visit on the Internet and the material
contained in your files and e-mail. Current auditing technology allows Corel to conduct a detailed
Internet audit which includes tracking the Internet sites that you visit and identifying Corel
employees who visit certain sites. Anything you create, store, send, post or otherwise access
and/or transmit via the Network should not be considered private. Your use of passwords, access
codes, account numbers or other Network-related authorizations does not necessarily ensure privacy.<br><BR style="font-size:6pt">
You are responsible for using the Network in an ethical and lawful manner, including as follows:
</DIV>


<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt; margin-left: 4%">Your use of the Network must comply with all relevant intellectual property laws,
inclusive of copyright and the terms and conditions of third party software license
or Network-related agreements to which you or Corel are a party. Without limiting
the foregoing, you are not to knowingly use the Network (I)&nbsp;to operate software that
has been copied illegally; and/or (ii)&nbsp;to transmit software to third parties without
written authorization from your Director. Software that is licensed to you
personally may not be used on the Network without the prior written authorization of
your Director.
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt; margin-left: 4%">You are not to use the Network to create, store, send, post or otherwise access and/or transmit
inappropriate, offensive and/or illegal material, including but not limited to, harassing,
embarrassing, sexually explicit and pornographic material (collectively referred to
&#147;Inappropriate Material&#148;). Participation in chat groups, discussion groups, newsletters
and/or other public forums that contain or make reference to Inappropriate Material is
similarly prohibited. Should you encounter Inappropriate Material on the Network, you agree
to report it to the Human Resources Department. Should you mistakenly access Inappropriate
Material, you agree to advise the Human Resources Department.</DIV>


<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt; margin-left: 4%">You will not use the Network to knowingly make or disseminate any defamatory, negligent or other
similar statements.</DIV>


<P align="center" style="font-size: 10pt"><!-- Folio -->&nbsp;<!-- /Folio -->
</DIV>

<!-- PAGEBREAK -->
<P><HR noshade><P>
<H5 align="left" style="page-break-before:always">&nbsp;</H5><P>

<DIV style="font-family: 'Times New Roman',Times,serif">




<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;You have an obligation to safeguard the Network&#146;s integrity and security. You are responsible
for all transactions and transmissions made using your password, unless your password was illegally
obtained by a third party. You agree to not disclose confidential passwords, access codes, account
numbers or other Network-related authorizations that are assigned to you from time to time. You
are not to destroy, password protect, encrypt or remove software or data without prior written
authorization from your Manager. You may be required to disclose your password or assist with the
decryption of a file to allow access by authorized Corel employees. You agree not to attempt to
access or use the Network through the use of another users I.D. or password or to otherwise
misrepresent yourself as another user of the Network.
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">Remote access privileges are for Corel employees only. Any access by a third party (such as a
friend, spouse or roommate) will result in immediate withdrawal of all remote access privileges and
may result in further disciplinary action.
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">You acknowledge and agree that, from time to time, Corel may provide you with notice of changes to
this policy&#146;s terms and conditions and that such changes shall be binding upon you.<br><BR style="font-size:6pt">
Violation of this policy may result in disciplinary action, including dismissal for cause, and/or
subject you to penalties or civil, criminal and/or copyright proceedings. Corel will cooperate
fully with local, provincial, state and federal officials in any investigation that is
Network-related.
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 12pt"><B>ACKNOWLEDGMENT</B>
</DIV>


<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">I hereby acknowledge receiving and reading a copy of the above Corporate Policy &#151; Network Use and
Security on the date indicated below and I agree to abide and be bound by the above terms and
conditions, as amended from time to time.
</DIV>
<DIV align="center">

<!-- PAGEBREAK -->
<DIV style="font-family: 'Times New Roman',Times,serif">
<DIV align="right" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 12pt"><b>Exhibit 10.16</b></div>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 12pt">PERSONAL &#038; CONFIDENTIAL
</DIV>


<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">July&nbsp;3, 2008

</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">David C. Dobson

</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">Dear David:

</DIV>
<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">This letter confirms your resignation from Corel Corporation (&#147;Corel&#148;) effective June&nbsp;30, 2008 and
sets out the terms on which you have agreed to provide transitional services to Corel.
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">The terms and conditions set out below are conditional on you signing and returning to Corel this
letter and the release attached as Schedule&nbsp;A (the &#147;Release&#148;) on or before July&nbsp;7, 2008 after which
time this letter is automatically revoked.
</DIV>


<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt">
<TABLE width="100%" border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="font-size: 10pt">

<TR valign="top" style="font-size: 10pt; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    <TD width="2%">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD width="1%" nowrap align="left"><B>1.</B></TD>
    <TD width="1%">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD><U><B>Period of Transitional Assistance</B></U></TD>
</TR>

</TABLE>
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt">
<TABLE width="100%" border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="font-size: 10pt">

<TR valign="top" style="font-size: 10pt; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    <TD width="4%" style="background: transparent">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD width="3%" nowrap align="left">a)</TD>
    <TD width="1%">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD>You have agreed to provide your services to Corel until June&nbsp;30,
2008, or until such earlier time as Corel may advise you at anytime after the ate
of this letter (the &#147;Transition Period&#148;). During the Transition Period, you will
continue as a Director and Office of Corel. During the Transition Period you will,
to the best of your ability, work with the Special Committee that was formed in
response to the proposal received from Vector Capital (the &#147;Special Committee&#148;).
In addition, during the Transition Period you will, to the best of your ability,
work with the Board of Directors of Corel (the &#147;Board&#148;), Corel&#146;s management team
and the interim Chief Executive Officer of Corel, as requested by the Board and
Interim Chief Executive Officer.</TD>
</TR>

<TR>
    <TD style="font-size: 6pt">&nbsp;</TD>
</TR><TR valign="top" style="font-size: 10pt; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    <TD width="2%" style="background: transparent">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD width="3%" nowrap align="left">b)</TD>
    <TD width="1%">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD>During the Transition Period, you have the opportunity to earn a
bonus in the based on the value you provide to the Special Committee during the
Transition Period, to a maximum of $200,000. The amount, if any, payable shall be
at the discretion of the independent Directors of Corel, in consultation with the
Special Committee.</TD>
</TR>

<TR>
    <TD style="font-size: 6pt">&nbsp;</TD>
</TR><TR valign="top" style="font-size: 10pt; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    <TD width="2%" style="background: transparent">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD width="3%" nowrap align="left">c)</TD>
    <TD width="1%">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD>Your base salary (of $415,000 Canadian annually) will cease effective
at the end of the Transition Period and your sole entitlements to other
compensation and to benefits shall be:</TD>
</TR>

</TABLE>
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt">
<TABLE width="100%" border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="font-size: 10pt">

<TR valign="top" style="font-size: 10pt; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    <TD width="8%" style="background: transparent">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD width="3%" nowrap align="left">(i)</TD>
    <TD width="1%">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD>continued participation in Corel&#146;s
benefit plans for the Transition Period.</TD>
</TR>

<TR>
    <TD style="font-size: 6pt">&nbsp;</TD>
</TR><TR valign="top" style="font-size: 10pt; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    <TD width="6%" style="background: transparent">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD width="3%" nowrap align="left">(ii)</TD>
    <TD width="1%">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD>the discretionary bonus referred to
in subparagraph 1(b) above;</TD>
</TR>

<TR>
    <TD style="font-size: 6pt">&nbsp;</TD>
</TR><TR valign="top" style="font-size: 10pt; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    <TD width="6%" style="background: transparent">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD width="3%" nowrap align="left">(iii)</TD>
    <TD width="1%">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD>payment of the greater of:</TD>
</TR>

</TABLE>
</DIV>
<P align="center" style="font-size: 10pt"><!-- Folio -->&nbsp;<!-- /Folio -->
</DIV>

<!-- PAGEBREAK -->
<P><HR noshade><P>
<H5 align="left" style="page-break-before:always">&nbsp;</H5><P>

<DIV style="font-family: 'Times New Roman',Times,serif">


<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt"><TABLE width="100%" border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="font-size: 10pt">



</TABLE>
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt">
<TABLE width="100%" border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="font-size: 10pt">

<TR valign="top" style="font-size: 10pt; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    <TD width="8%" style="background: transparent">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD width="3%" nowrap align="left">A.</TD>
    <TD width="1%">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD>$300,000 Canadian; and</TD>
</TR>

<TR>
    <TD style="font-size: 6pt">&nbsp;</TD>
</TR><TR valign="top" style="font-size: 10pt; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    <TD width="8%" style="background: transparent">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD width="3%" nowrap align="left">B.</TD>
    <TD width="1%">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD>your incentive
payment pursuant to Corel&#146;s annual incentive plan to May
31, 2008, based on actual performance to May&nbsp;31, 2008 (in
accordance with your annual incentive plan target of
$415,000 Canadian with 40% measured against Corporate
Revenue attainment and 60% measured again Corporate
EBITDA attainment),plus the tax gross-ups relating to
your 2007 apartment and travel in the amount of $52,246
Canadian, plus pay in respect of your accrued unused
vacation to the end of the Transition Period.</TD>
</TR>

</TABLE>
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt">
<TABLE width="100%" border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="font-size: 10pt">

<TR valign="top" style="font-size: 10pt; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    <TD width="2%" style="background: transparent">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD width="3%" nowrap align="left">(d)</TD>
    <TD width="1%">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD>All of your unvested options granted June&nbsp;27 and October&nbsp;1, 2005 will
vest on June&nbsp;30, 2008 and you may exercise all outstanding options until the
earlier of&#148;</TD>
</TR>

</TABLE>
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt">
<TABLE width="100%" border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="font-size: 10pt">

<TR valign="top" style="font-size: 10pt; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    <TD width="6%" style="background: transparent">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD width="3%" nowrap align="left">(i)</TD>
    <TD width="1%">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD>December&nbsp;31, 2008; and</TD>
</TR>

<TR>
    <TD style="font-size: 6pt">&nbsp;</TD>
</TR><TR valign="top" style="font-size: 10pt; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    <TD width="6%" style="background: transparent">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD width="3%" nowrap align="left">(ii)</TD>
    <TD width="1%">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD>their original expiry date.</TD>
</TR>

</TABLE>
</DIV>


<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt; margin-left: 6%">All of your options granted July&nbsp;17, 2007 shall be forfeited on June&nbsp;30,
2008.
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt">
<TABLE width="100%" border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="font-size: 10pt">

<TR valign="top" style="font-size: 10pt; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    <TD width="1%">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD width="1%" nowrap align="left"><B>2.</B></TD>
    <TD width="1%">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD><U><B>Company Property</B></U></TD>
</TR>

<TR>
    <TD style="font-size: 6pt">&nbsp;</TD>
</TR><TR valign="top" style="font-size: 10pt; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    <TD width="1%">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD width="1%" nowrap align="left">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD width="1%">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD>All company property must be returned to Corel at the end of the Transition Period,
including but not limited to: financial information, customer lists, marketing and
technical materials, cell phones, pagers, blackberries, desk keys, company credit
cards, company calling cards, computers and computer equipment, security badges, CD
ROMS and any other Corel materials you may have.</TD>
</TR>

<TR>
    <TD style="font-size: 6pt">&nbsp;</TD>
</TR><TR valign="top" style="font-size: 10pt; color: #000000; background: transparent">

    <TD width="1%">&nbsp;</TD>    <TD width="1%" nowrap align="left"><B>3.</B></TD>
    <TD width="1%">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD><U><B>Taxes and Currency</B></U></TD>
</TR>

<TR>
    <TD style="font-size: 6pt">&nbsp;</TD>
</TR><TR valign="top" style="font-size: 10pt; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    <TD width="1%">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD width="1%" nowrap align="left">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD width="1%">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD>All amounts payable under this Agreement are subject to applicable taxes and
withholdings and you are solely responsible for the payment of all taxes owing as a
result of the payments and benefits provided to you under this Agreement. All amounts
referred to in this letter are in Canadian currency.</TD>
</TR>

<TR>
    <TD style="font-size: 6pt">&nbsp;</TD>
</TR><TR valign="top" style="font-size: 10pt; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    <TD width="1%">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD width="1%" nowrap align="left"><B>4.</B></TD>
    <TD width="1%">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD><U><B>Resignation From Other Positions</B></U></TD>
</TR>

<TR>
    <TD style="font-size: 6pt">&nbsp;</TD>
</TR><TR valign="top" style="font-size: 10pt; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    <TD width="1%">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD width="1%" nowrap align="left">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD width="1%">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD>All officer positions you hold with Corel and its affiliated entities are terminated at
the end of the Transition Period, or at such earlier time as is requested by Corel and
you agree to resign from all director positions you
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
</DIV>
<P align="center" style="font-size: 10pt"><!-- Folio -->&nbsp;<!-- /Folio -->
</DIV>

<!-- PAGEBREAK -->
<P><HR noshade><P>
<H5 align="left" style="page-break-before:always">&nbsp;</H5><P>

<DIV style="font-family: 'Times New Roman',Times,serif">

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt"><TABLE width="100%" border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="font-size: 10pt">

<TR valign="top" style="font-size: 10pt; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    <TD width="1%">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD width="1%" nowrap align="left">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD width="1%">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD>then hold with Corel and its affiliated entities at the end of the Transition Period,
or at such earlier time as is requested by Corel.</TD>
</TR>

<TR>
    <TD style="font-size: 6pt">&nbsp;</TD>
</TR><TR valign="top" style="font-size: 10pt; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    <TD width="1%">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD width="1%" nowrap align="left"><B>5.</B></TD>
    <TD width="1%">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD><U><B>Confidentiality, Non-Compete, Fiduciary Duties</B></U></TD>
</TR>

<TR>
    <TD style="font-size: 6pt">&nbsp;</TD>
</TR><TR valign="top" style="font-size: 10pt; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    <TD width="1%">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD width="1%" nowrap align="left">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD width="1%">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD>You are reminded that you are required to comply with the Confidentiality,
Non-Competition, Non-Solicitation and Intellectual Property covenants in your agreement
with Corel dated effective June&nbsp;17, 2005, as amended November&nbsp;1, 2005. You are also
reminded that you owe fiduciary obligations to Corel, which includes an obligation to
act in good faith and in the best interests of Corel.</TD>
</TR>

<TR>
    <TD style="font-size: 6pt">&nbsp;</TD>
</TR><TR valign="top" style="font-size: 10pt; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    <TD width="1%">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD width="1%" nowrap align="left"><B>6.</B></TD>
    <TD width="1%">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD><U><B>Speakwell</B></U></TD>
</TR>

<TR>
    <TD style="font-size: 6pt">&nbsp;</TD>
</TR><TR valign="top" style="font-size: 10pt; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    <TD width="1%">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD width="1%" nowrap align="left">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD width="1%">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD>You covenant and agree to speak positively of Corel and its employees, directors or
affiliates at all times. Corel covenants and agrees to speak positively of you at all
times. Should either you or Corel have occasion to comment on your departure or time at
Corel, both parties will do so in a manner that reflects the high level of mutual
respect and the amicable nature of this agreement.</TD>
</TR>

</TABLE>
</DIV>
<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">You agree to keep this Agreement and its terms confidential and not to discuss it with others.
</DIV>


<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 12pt">Sincerely,
</DIV>


<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">/s/ KRIS HAGERMAN

</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">Kris Hagerman<BR>
Interim Chief Executive Officer

</DIV>
<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">I have read, understand and agree to the terms set out in the Agreement. I have been advised to
seek independent legal advice in connection with this agreement and have sought or waive such
advice.
</DIV>

<DIV align="center">
<TABLE style="font-size: 10pt" cellspacing="0" border="0" cellpadding="0" width="100%">

</DIV>


<P align="center" style="font-size: 10pt"><!-- Folio -->&nbsp;<!-- /Folio -->
</DIV>

<!-- PAGEBREAK -->
<P><HR noshade><P>
<H5 align="left" style="page-break-before:always">&nbsp;</H5><P>

<DIV style="font-family: 'Times New Roman',Times,serif">


<DIV align="center" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 18pt"><B>SCHEDULE A</B>
</DIV>


<DIV align="Center" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt"><B>FULL AND FINAL RELEASE</B>

</DIV>
<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">I, DAVID C. DOBSON, on my own behalf and that of my heirs, executors and assigns, in consideration
of the terms and conditions set out in my Agreement with Corel Corporation (&#147; COREL &#147;) dated July
3, 2008 (the &#147;Transition Agreement&#148;), payments made to me pursuant to those terms and conditions
and other good and valuable consideration, the sufficiency of which is hereby acknowledged, do
hereby release and forever discharge Corel, its subsidiaries, parents, predecessors, successors,
related companies, affiliates, divisions and their present and former directors, officers,
representatives, shareholders, owners, employees, administrators, agents and lawyers (collectively,
the &#148; RELEASEES &#147;) jointly and severally, from any and all actions, causes of action, covenants,
contracts, claims, demands, complaints, proceedings, grievances, damages, costs or loss of any
nature or kind, past, present or future arising out of or in any way relating to or connected with
my hiring, my employment with Corel or the termination of my employment, stock options or other
share based incentive plans and benefit plans.
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">I do hereby declare and acknowledge that the consideration set out above satisfies all obligations
of the Releasees, arising from or out of my hiring, my employment with Corel or the termination of
my employment, stock options or other share based incentive plans and benefit plans including,
without <I>limitation </I>any obligations under <I>Employment Standards</I>, <I>Human Rights </I>and <I>Workplace Safety</I>
and <I>Insurance </I>legislation, or any similar legislation in any other jurisdiction. I covenant and
undertake that I will not file or advance any claims or complaints under the <I>Employment Standards</I>
legislation including claims in respect of pay in lieu of notice and severance pay, <I>Human Rights</I>
legislation and <I>Work place Safety </I>and <I>Insurance </I>legislation or any similar legislation in any other
jurisdiction, arising out of my hiring, my employment with Corel or the termination of my
employment, stock options or other share based incentive plans and benefit plans.
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">And for the said consideration, I further agree not to make any claim or take any other proceedings
against any person, entity, corporation, partnership or Crown in which any claim could or does
arise with respect to any matters which may have arisen between the parties to this release up to
the present time, concerning and relating to any action I may have as against any other party as a
result or my hiring, my employment with Corel or termination of my employment, stock options or
other share based incentive plans and benefit plans.
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">Notwithstanding the foregoing, I do not release my rights and entitlements to enforce my rights
under the Transition Agreement or any right or entitlement I may have to indemnity or to enforce
any indemnity as a director or officer of Corel or its affiliates or to benefits under any policy
of directors and officers insurance.
</DIV>


<P align="center" style="font-size: 10pt"><!-- Folio -->&nbsp;<!-- /Folio -->
</DIV>

<!-- PAGEBREAK -->
<P><HR noshade><P>
<H5 align="left" style="page-break-before:always">&nbsp;</H5><P>

<DIV style="font-family: 'Times New Roman',Times,serif">



<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">And for said consideration I further agree to save harmless and indemnify the Releasees from and
against any and all claims, charges, taxes, penalties or demands made by the Canada Revenue Agency,
its predecessors or successors, or any similar governmental authority in any other jurisdiction,
requiring any of the Releasees to pay any amounts under the <I>Income Tax Act </I>(Canada) and other duly
recognized federal, provincial and local taxing authorities in respect of income tax payable by me
in excess of the income tax previous withheld, and from and against any and all claims, charges,
taxes or penalties and demands made on behalf of or related to Employment Insurance or Canada
Pension Plan under the applicable statutes and regulations, or any other similar legislation in any
other jurisdiction, with respect to any amounts which may, in the future, be found to be payable by
any of the Releasees with respect to the payment of the consideration referred to above.
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">It is understood and agreed that the giving of the consideration set out above is deemed to be no
admission of liability whatsoever on the part of the Releasees and, in fact, any liability is
expressly denied.
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">I will not say, publish or do any act or thing that disparages or casts the Releasees in any
unfavorable light, or which could result in injury to their reputation. Except to the extent
required by applicable law, I will make no public statements or announcements regarding my past
employment with Corel or any of the matters set forth herein without first consulting with Corel
and obtaining its prior written approval as to the timing and content of the proposed statements or
announcements. Notwithstanding the foregoing, I understand that I may disclose particulars of my
past employment with Corel and my termination therefrom in a bona fide job search or application
for government employment insurance benefits.
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">And I hereby declare that I have read and fully understand this release. I have had the opportunity
to seek independent legal advice. I understand that this release contains a full and final release
of any claims, which I have or may have relating to my hiring, my employment with Corel and my
resignation of employment, stock option or other share based incentive plans and benefit plans. I
voluntarily accept the said consideration for the purpose of making full and final compromise,
adjustment and settlement of all claims as set out above.
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">IN WITNESS WHEREOF, I, DAVID C. DOBSON set my hand and seal hereto
 this 3  day of  July, 2008.
</DIV>


<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">SIGNED, SEALED AND DELIVERED<BR>
In the presence of

</DIV>
<DIV align="center">

<DOCUMENT>
<TYPE>EX-10.17
<SEQUENCE>6
<FILENAME>y74507exv10w17.htm
<DESCRIPTION>EX-10.17: AMENDED 2006 EQUITY INCENTIVE PLAN
<TEXT>
<HTML>
<HEAD>
<TITLE>EX-10.17</TITLE>
</HEAD>
<BODY bgcolor="#FFFFFF">
<!-- PAGEBREAK -->
<DIV style="font-family: 'Times New Roman',Times,serif">


<DIV align="right" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 12pt"><B>Exhibit&nbsp;10.17</B>
</DIV>


<DIV align="center" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 18pt"><B>AMENDED 2006 EQUITY INCENTIVE PLAN</B>
</DIV>

</DIV>
<!-- PAGEBREAK -->
<P><HR noshade><P>
<H5 align="left" style="page-break-before:always">&nbsp;</H5><P>
<DIV style="font-family: 'Times New Roman',Times,serif">
<P align="center" style="font-size: 10pt"><!-- Folio -->&nbsp;<!-- /Folio -->



<DIV align="center" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 18pt"><B>COREL CORPORATION</B>
</DIV>


<DIV align="Center" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt"><B>EQUITY INCENTIVE PLAN</B>

</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt"><B>SECTION&nbsp;1. PURPOSE. </B>The purposes of this Corel Corporation Equity Incentive Plan (the &#147;Plan&#148;) are
to encourage selected employees, officers, directors and consultants of, and other individuals
providing services to, Corel Corporation (together with any successor, the &#147;Company&#148;) and its
Affiliates (as defined below) to acquire a proprietary interest in the growth and performance of
the Company, to generate an increased incentive to contribute to the Company&#146;s future success and
prosperity thus enhancing the value of the Company for the benefit of its shareholders, and to
enhance the ability of the Company and its Affiliates to attract and retain exceptionally qualified
individuals upon whom, in large measure, the sustained progress, growth and profitability of the
Company depend.
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt"><B>SECTION&nbsp;2. DEFINITIONS. </B>As used in the Plan, the following terms will have the meanings set out
below:
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">&#147;<B>Affiliate</B>&#148; means, with respect to any entity, any entity that, directly or through one or more
intermediaries, is controlled by such entity, including any entity in which such entity owns a
significant equity interest, as determined by the Committee.
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">&#147;<B>Award</B>&#148; means any Option, Share Appreciation Right, Restricted Share, Restricted Share Unit,
Performance Share Unit, or Other Share-Based Award granted under the Plan.
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">&#147;<B>Award Agreement</B>&#148; means any written agreement, contract or other instrument or document evidencing
any Award granted under the Plan.
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">&#147;<B>Blackout Period</B>&#148; means the period imposed by the Company, during which a Participant may not trade
in the Company&#146;s securities and includes any period during which a Participant has material
non-public information, but does not include any period when a regulator has halted trading in the
Company&#146;s securities.
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">&#147;<B>Board</B>&#148; means the Board of Directors of the Company.
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">&#147;<B>Cause</B>&#148;, as used in connection with the termination of a Participant&#146;s employment, means (1)&nbsp;with
respect to any Participant employed under a written employment agreement with the Company or an
Affiliate of the Company which agreement includes a definition of &#147;cause,&#148; &#147;cause&#148; as defined in
that agreement or, if that agreement contains no such definition, a material breach by the
Participant of that agreement, or (2)&nbsp;with respect to any other Participant, the failure to perform
adequately in carrying out the Participant&#146;s employment responsibilities, including any directives
from the Board, or the Participant engaging in behavior in the Participant&#146;s personal or business
life as to lead the Committee in its reasonable judgment to determine that it is in the best
interests of the Company to terminate the Participant&#146;s employment.
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">&#147;<B>Code</B>&#148; means the <I>Internal Revenue Code of 1986</I>, as amended from time to time, and the regulations
promulgated under it.
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">&#147;<B>Committee</B>&#148; means the Compensation Committee of the Board, provided, however, to the extent deemed
necessary or appropriate, a committee other than the Compensation Committee may be designated by
the Board to administer the Plan and such other committee may be vested with any of the powers and
responsibilities hereunder and shall be considered the Committee for any and all of such purposes
hereunder. To the extent the Company desires to grant Incentive Stock Options, such committee shall
be composed of not less than two directors of the Company, neither of whom shall be employees of
the Company or its Affiliates and each of whom shall otherwise be &#147;outside directors&#148; for purposes
of Section 162(m) of the Code. To the extent the Company is no longer a &#147;foreign private issuer&#148; as
defined in Exchange Act Rule&nbsp;3b-4 and wishes to have a &#147;Qualified Plan&#148; as defined in Rule
16b-3(b)(4), such committee shall be composed of not less than two directors of the Company, each
of whom are &#147;non-employee directors&#148; for purposes of Exchange Act Section&nbsp;16 and Rule&nbsp;16b-3
thereunder.
</DIV>
</DIV>
<!-- PAGEBREAK -->
<P><HR noshade><P>
<H5 align="left" style="page-break-before:always">&nbsp;</H5><P>
<DIV style="font-family: 'Times New Roman',Times,serif">
<P align="center" style="font-size: 10pt"><!-- Folio -->- 2 -<!-- /Folio -->

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">&#147;<B>Common Shares</B>&#148; means any or all, as applicable, of the common shares of the Company and any other
securities or property as may become the subject of Awards, or become subject to Awards, pursuant
to an adjustment made under Section 4(b) of the Plan and any other securities of the Company or any
Affiliate or any successor that may be so designated by the Committee.
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">&#147;<B>Consultant</B>&#148; means any consultant of, or other individual providing services to, the Company or any
Affiliate, provided that, for purposes of Awards made to individuals in Canada, a consultant means
a person that (1)&nbsp;is engaged to provide services to the Company and/or an Affiliate, other than
services provided in relation to a distribution of securities, (2)&nbsp;provides the services under a
written contract with the Company and/or the Affiliate and (3)&nbsp;spends or will spend a significant
amount of time and attention on the affairs and business of the Company and/or the Affiliate.
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">&#147;<B>Control Person</B>&#148; means, with respect to any entity, a person that controls such entity.
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">&#147;<B>Employee</B>&#148; means any employee of the Company or of any Affiliate.
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">&#147;<B>Exchange </B>Act&#148; means the <I>United States Securities Exchange Act of 1934</I>, as amended.
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">&#147;<B>Fair Market Value</B>&#148; means (1)&nbsp;with respect to any property other than the Common Shares, the fair
market value of that property determined by those methods or procedures as may be established from
time to time by the Committee and (2)&nbsp;with respect to the Common Shares, the closing sale price
reported for such Common Shares on the date of reference on the Principal Market. If there is no
closing sale price reported on any such date, the Fair Market Value will be determined by the
Committee in accordance with the regulations promulgated under Section&nbsp;2031 of the Code, or by any
other appropriate method selected by the Committee.
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">&#147;<B>Good Reason</B>&#148;, as used in connection with the termination of a Participant&#146;s employment, means (1)
with respect to any Participant employed under a written employment agreement with the Company or
an Affiliate of the Company, &#147;good reason&#148; or similar term as defined in that written agreement or,
if such agreement contains no such definition, a material breach by the Company of that agreement,
or (2)&nbsp;with respect to any other Participant, a failure by the Company to pay that Participant any
amount otherwise vested and due and a continuation of that failure for 30 business days following
notice to the Company of that failure.
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">&#147;<B>Incentive Stock Option</B>&#148; means an option granted under Section 6(a) of the Plan that is intended to
meet the requirements of Section&nbsp;422 of the Code or any successor provision.
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">&#147;<B>insider</B>&#148; has the same meaning as found in the <I>Securities Act (Ontario)</I>, as amended, and also
includes associates and affiliates of the insider; and &#147;issuances to insiders&#148; includes direct and
indirect issuances to insiders.
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">&#147;<B>Non-Qualified Stock Option</B>&#148; means an option granted under Section 6(a) of the Plan that is not
intended to be an Incentive Stock Option. Any stock option granted by the Committee which is not
designated an Incentive Stock Option will be deemed a Non-Qualified Stock Option.
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">&#147;<B>Option</B>&#148; means an Incentive Stock Option or a Non-Qualified Stock Option.
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">&#147;<B>Other Share-Based Award</B>&#148; means any right granted under Section&nbsp;6(e)(i) of the Plan.
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">&#147;<B>Participant</B>&#148; means any individual granted an Award under the Plan.
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">&#147;<B>Performance Share Unit</B>&#148; means any right granted under Section 6(e) of the Plan.
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">&#147;<B>Person</B>&#148; means any individual, corporation, partnership, association, joint-stock company, trust,
unincorporated organization, or government or political subdivision of a government.
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">&#147;<B>Principal Market</B>&#148; means the principal stock exchange, quotation system or other market on which
the Common Shares are listed, admitted to trading, posted for trading or quoted upon which has
occurred the greatest trading
</DIV>
</DIV>
<!-- PAGEBREAK -->
<P><HR noshade><P>
<H5 align="left" style="page-break-before:always">&nbsp;</H5><P>
<DIV style="font-family: 'Times New Roman',Times,serif">
<P align="center" style="font-size: 10pt"><!-- Folio -->- 3 -<!-- /Folio -->


<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">volume of the Common Shares for the six months (or, to the extent the Common Shares have not been
listed, admitted to trading, posted for trading or quoted for at least six months, the next longest
period since the Common Shares were initially listed, admitted to trading, posted for trading or
quoted) prior to the date of reference, provided, however, that to the extent deemed necessary or
appropriate, the Principal Market shall be as determined by the Committee in accordance with
applicable law, rules and regulations.
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">&#147;<B>Released Securities</B>&#148; means securities that were Restricted Shares but with respect to which all
applicable restrictions have expired, lapsed or been waived in accordance with the terms of the
Plan or the applicable Award Agreement.
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">&#147;<B>Restricted Shares</B>&#148; means any Common Shares granted under Section 6(c) of the Plan, any right
granted under Section 6(c) of the Plan that is denominated in Common Shares or any other Award
under which issued and outstanding Common Shares are held subject to certain restrictions.
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">&#147;<B>Restricted Share Unit</B>&#148; means a right to receive a Common Share or the Fair Market Value of a
Common Share granted under Section 6(d) of the Plan.
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">&#147;<B>Securities Act</B>&#148; means the <I>United States Securities Act of 1933</I>, as amended.
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">&#147;<B>Share Appreciation Right</B>&#148; means any right granted under Section 6(b) of the Plan.
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">&#147;<B>Significant Event</B>&#148; means, unless otherwise defined in an Award Agreement or a written employment
agreement between the Company and a Participant (which definition shall govern), the occurrence of
any of the following events: (1)&nbsp;a person or group of persons becomes the beneficial owner of
securities of the Company constituting 50% or more of the voting power of all outstanding voting
securities of the Company, (2)&nbsp;a majority of the Company&#146;s Board as of the date of adoption of this
Plan (including any successors approved by the then existing Board) cease to constitute a majority
of the Board; (3)&nbsp;a merger, consolidation, amalgamation or arrangement of the Company (or a similar
transaction) occurs, unless after the event, 50% or more of the voting power of the combined
company is beneficially owned by the same person or group of persons as immediately before the
event; or (4)&nbsp;the Company&#146;s shareholders approve a plan of complete liquidation or winding-up of
the Company, or the sale or disposition of all or substantially all the Company&#146;s assets (other
than a transfer to an Affiliate of the Company); provided that the following shall not constitute a
Significant Event: (i)&nbsp;any person or group of persons becoming the beneficial owner of the
threshold of securities specified in (1)&nbsp;as a result of the acquisition of securities by the
Company or a subsidiary which, by reducing the number of securities outstanding, increases the
proportional number of securities beneficially held by that person or group of persons, (ii)&nbsp;any
acquisition of securities directly from the Company in connection with a bona fide financing or
series of financings by the Company, (iii)&nbsp;any acquisition by an employee benefit plan (or related
trust) sponsored or maintained by the Company or its Affiliates or (iv)&nbsp;beneficial ownership by
Corel Holdings, L.P., its Affiliates and/or its Control Persons or any increased ownership by any
of them.
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">&#147;<B>U.S. Participant</B>&#148; means any Participant residing in the United States or who is a U.S. citizen.
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 12pt"><B>SECTION&nbsp;3. ADMINISTRATION.</B>
</DIV>


<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt">
<TABLE width="100%" border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="font-size: 10pt">

<TR valign="top" style="font-size: 10pt; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    <TD width="2%" style="background: transparent">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD width="3%" nowrap align="left">(a)</TD>
    <TD width="1%">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD>The Plan will be administered by the Committee subject to the Committee
reporting to the Board as required by the Committee&#146;s mandate.</TD>
</TR>

<TR>
    <TD style="font-size: 6pt">&nbsp;</TD>
</TR><TR valign="top" style="font-size: 10pt; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    <TD width="2%" style="background: transparent">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD width="3%" nowrap align="left">(b)</TD>
    <TD width="1%">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD>Subject to the terms of the Plan and applicable law, and in addition to other
express powers and authorizations conferred on the Committee by the Plan, the Committee
will have full power and authority to, subject to the Plan: (1)&nbsp;designate Participants;
(2)&nbsp;determine the type or types of Awards to be granted to an eligible Employee or
other individual under the Plan; (3)&nbsp;determine the number and classification of Common
Shares to be covered by (or with respect to which payments, rights or other matters are
to be calculated in connection with) Awards; (4)&nbsp;determine the terms and conditions of
any Award; (5)&nbsp;determine whether, to what extent, and under what circumstances Awards
may be settled or exercised in cash, Common Shares, other securities, other</TD>
</TR>

</TABLE>
</DIV></DIV>
<!-- PAGEBREAK -->
<P><HR noshade><P>
<H5 align="left" style="page-break-before:always">&nbsp;</H5><P>
<DIV style="font-family: 'Times New Roman',Times,serif">
<P align="center" style="font-size: 10pt"><!-- Folio -->- 4 -<!-- /Folio -->

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt"><TABLE width="100%" border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="font-size: 10pt">


<TR valign="top" style="font-size: 10pt; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    <TD width="2%" style="background: transparent">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD width="3%" nowrap align="left">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD width="1%">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD>Awards or other property, or canceled, forfeited or suspended, and the method or
methods by which Awards may be settled, exercised, canceled, forfeited or suspended;
(6)&nbsp;determine requirements for the vesting or exercisability of Awards or
performance criteria to be achieved in order for Awards to vest, the acceleration of
vesting or the waiver of forfeiture or other restrictions on awards; (7)&nbsp;determine
whether, to what extent and under what circumstances cash, Common Shares, other
securities, other Awards, other property and other amounts payable with respect to
an Award under the Plan will be deferred either automatically or at the election of
the holder or of the Committee; (8)&nbsp;interpret and administer the Plan and any
instrument or agreement relating to, or Award made under, the Plan; (9)&nbsp;establish,
amend, suspend or waive any rules and regulations and appoint any agents as it will
deem appropriate for the proper administration of the Plan; (10)&nbsp;determine whether
awards will be adjusted for dividend entitlements; (11)&nbsp;amend or adjust the terms
and conditions of outstanding Awards; (12)&nbsp;implement an Award exchange program, (13)
arrange for financing by broker-dealers (including payment by the Company of
commissions) and establish award exercise procedures, (14)&nbsp;establish procedures for
payment of withholding tax obligations with cash or shares and (15)&nbsp;make any other
determination and take any other action that the Committee deems necessary or
desirable for the administration of the Plan.</TD>
</TR>

<TR>
    <TD style="font-size: 6pt">&nbsp;</TD>
</TR><TR valign="top" style="font-size: 10pt; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    <TD width="2%" style="background: transparent">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD width="3%" nowrap align="left">(c)</TD>
    <TD width="1%">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD>Unless otherwise expressly provided in the Plan, all designations,
determinations, interpretations and other decisions under or with respect to the Plan
or any Award will be within the sole discretion of the Committee, may be made at any
time and will be final, conclusive and binding upon all Persons, including the Company,
any Affiliate, any Participant, any holder or beneficiary of any Award, any shareholder
and any Employee.</TD>
</TR>

<TR>
    <TD style="font-size: 6pt">&nbsp;</TD>
</TR><TR valign="top" style="font-size: 10pt; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    <TD width="2%" style="background: transparent">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD width="3%" nowrap align="left">(d)</TD>
    <TD width="1%">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD>Any reference in this Plan to the date of termination or cessation or a
Participant&#146;s employment shall mean the Participant&#146;s last day of active employment and
shall not include any period of statutory, contractual or reasonable notice or any
period of deemed employment.</TD>
</TR>

<TR>
    <TD style="font-size: 6pt">&nbsp;</TD>
</TR><TR valign="top" style="font-size: 10pt; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    <TD width="2%" style="background: transparent">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD width="3%" nowrap align="left">(e)</TD>
    <TD width="1%">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD>Notwithstanding the foregoing, the maximum number of Common Shares underlying
or relating to Awards which may be granted to any one Participant under this Plan in
any calendar year will not exceed 500,000 Common Shares, subject to the adjustments
provided in Section&nbsp;4(b), and no Awards under this Plan will be granted after December
31, 2015.</TD>
</TR>

<TR>
    <TD style="font-size: 6pt">&nbsp;</TD>
</TR><TR valign="top" style="font-size: 10pt; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    <TD width="2%" style="background: transparent">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD width="3%" nowrap align="left">(f)</TD>
    <TD width="1%">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD>Notwithstanding anything to the contrary in this Plan:</TD>
</TR>

</TABLE>
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt">
<TABLE width="100%" border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="font-size: 10pt">

<TR valign="top" style="font-size: 10pt; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    <TD width="6%" style="background: transparent">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD width="3%" nowrap align="left">(i)</TD>
    <TD width="1%">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD>the maximum number of securities of the Company issuable to
insiders at any time under (A)&nbsp;this Plan and (B)&nbsp;all of the Company&#146;s other
security based compensation arrangements, shall not exceed ten percent (10%) of
the Company&#146;s total issued and outstanding securities, subject to the
adjustments provided in Section&nbsp;4(b); and</TD>
</TR>

<TR>
    <TD style="font-size: 6pt">&nbsp;</TD>

    <TD width="6%" style="background: transparent">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD width="3%" nowrap align="left">(ii)</TD>
    <TD width="1%">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD>the maximum number of securities of the Company issued to
insiders within any one year period under (A)&nbsp;this Plan and (B)&nbsp;all of the
Company&#146;s other security based compensation arrangements, shall not exceed ten
percent (10%) of the Company&#146;s total issued and outstanding common shares,
subject to the adjustments provided in
Section&nbsp;4(b).</TD>
</TR>

</TABLE>
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 12pt"><B>SECTION&nbsp;4. COMMON SHARES AVAILABLE FOR AWARDS.</B>
</DIV>


<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt">

<TR valign="top" style="font-size: 10pt; color: #000000; background: transparent">
